moves.1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5: The Caro-Kann, a solid defense. But even this line can go sour quickly if mishandled.
moves.4. e5: ...White can do this, driving the Knight.
moves.4... Nfd7: Compounding the mistake. 4... N-N1 was the best retreat.
moves.5. e6: Now White sets a nasty pitfall. The correct play is 5... N-B3 6 PxP ch KxP, after which Black could fight on for a while.
moves.6... g6: Leaving White the choice of two mates. The plebeian way is 7 BxP ch PxB 8 QxP mate. Damant chooses the more elegant method.
